title: World Intellectual Property Day, 2025
summary:
The document is a proclamation by President Donald J. Trump, designating April 26, 2025, as World Intellectual Property Day. It emphasizes the significance of intellectual property in fostering American innovation, echoing the Founding Fathers' commitment to safeguarding creative achievements through constitutional protections. The proclamation outlines the administration's efforts to promote leadership in emerging technologies, such as artificial intelligence, and highlights the establishment of the Council of Advisors on Science and Technology to guide innovation policy.

The President stresses the importance of protecting intellectual property against exploitation by adversaries and allies alike, stating that the U.S. will use tariffs to strengthen intellectual property protections in trade agreements. He cites the economic benefits of safeguarding intellectual property, which fuels growth and competitiveness. The proclamation concludes by urging Americans to celebrate the contributions of creators and inventors, reaffirming the administration's commitment to fostering an innovative spirit that drives the nation's progress.
